job_info.role_description: Design and develop the user interface of web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

soft_skills: Ability to work independently and collaboratively

job_responsibilities: Design and develop the user interface of web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Collaborate with the development team to ensure that the user interface meets the specified requirements and quality standards
Debug and resolve issues in the front-end code, including performance and usability issues
Participate in code reviews and contribute to the development of new features and functionality
Develop and maintain reusable UI components and libraries
Participate in the development and maintenance of the application documentation
Stay current with industry trends and developments in front-end development

questions.question: A React functional component fetches a list of products inside useEffect and stores them in state, but a console.log right after setProducts shows the old array. Which statement best explains this behaviour and the correct way to read the updated value?

options.text: State updates are asynchronous; use another useEffect that depends on the products state to observe the new value.
setProducts is synchronous in development mode; the console.log must be wrapped in setTimeout(..., 0).
React batches all state updates only inside event handlers, not inside useEffect.
The state hook is broken; switch to a class component and use this.setState(callback).

questions.question: 2. You need to lazy-load an Angular feature module when the user navigates to /admin. Which router configuration accomplishes this without additional third-party libraries?
3. A Vue 3 component using the Composition API has an array of user objects. Which reactive reference declaration ensures that adding or deleting a user triggers re-rendering?
4. A webpack build produces a 3 MB vendor bundle in production. Which single built-in webpack optimisation is most effective to reduce the size without code changes?

options.text: Enable splitChunks.chunks: 'all' to share node_modules across entry points.
Increase devtool source-map resolution for better minification.
Disable SplitChunksPlugin and rely on terser-webpack-plugin alone.

questions.question: 5. You are styling a card that must be 300 px wide on desktop, 100% wide on mobile, and keep its aspect ratio 16:9. Which modern CSS snippet fulfils these requirements without JavaScript?
6. A Jest unit test fails with “Cannot find module ‘axios’” inside a Create-React-App project. The dependency is listed in package.json. Which action most likely fixes the error?

options.text: Run npm install --save-dev axios and clear the Jest cache with jest --clearCache.
Delete node_modules and package-lock.json, then reinstall.
Rename the test file from .test.js to .spec.js.

questions.question: 7. During a Cypress test, clicking a button opens a new tab, but Cypress loses control. Which official Cypress feature or recommended practice solves this?

options.text: Remove the target="_blank" attribute in the test before clicking.
Use cy.window().then(w => w.open = cy.stub()) to suppress new tabs.
Add { force: true } to the click command.
Switch to the new tab with cy.get('a').invoke('removeAttr', 'target').click().

questions.question: 8. A junior developer adds a CSS rule * { box-sizing: border-box } but notices horizontal scrollbars only on legacy Internet Explorer. Which CSS feature should be added to make the rule work on IE10+?

options.text: Add the HTML5 doctype <!doctype html> to trigger standards mode.
Include the meta tag X-UA-Compatible: IE=edge.

questions.question: 9. A React app uses Context for authentication. After login, the header bar does not re-render the user name. Which common mistake causes this, and how is it fixed?

options.text: The context value is a non-memoized object; wrap it in useMemo or useState.
The header reads from localStorage instead of context; switch to Redux.
React Context does not propagate to siblings; lift state to a parent.
The header must be a class component to subscribe to context changes.

questions.question: 10. An Angular template shows {{ price | currency }} but the pipe throws “InvalidPipeArgument” for price='12.5'. What is the minimal code change to display $12.50?

options.text: Convert the value to a number: price = parseFloat('12.5');
Replace the currency pipe with the number pipe.
Add a custom pipe that appends '$'.

questions.question: 11. In Vue 2, v-model on a custom component named <base-input> does not update the parent value. Which extra declaration is required inside base-input?

options.text: model: { prop: 'value', event: 'input' } and emit input on change.

questions.question: 12. A webpack loader chain processes SCSS files. Which loader order (right-to-left) is correct?
13. You need to test that a button is disabled when an input is empty using Testing-Library/React. Which matcher is the most idiomatic?
14. A flex container with justify-content: space-between leaves extra vertical space on the cross-axis. Which single property aligns the items to the top?
15. A junior engineer adds console.log in a React effect and notices it runs twice in development. Which React 18 feature causes this, and what is its purpose?

options.text: StrictMode mounts components twice to detect side effects.
React 18 uses concurrent rendering, always double-rendering.
The component is wrapped in <Suspense>; remove it to stop the rerun.
useEffect is deprecated; switch to useLayoutEffect.
